newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungary's O/N rates end lower at 19.50 percent.
newsitem.headline: Hungary's O/N rates end lower at 19.50 percent.

text.p: Hungary's overnight interest rates dropped to 19.50 percent in ample liquidity on Tuesday following Monday's repo rate cut by the central bank, traders said.
"Monday's rate cut contributed to the drop in overnight rates, but there is also the fact that we are at the beginning of the (bank's two-week) reserve period," said Jozsef Laczi of ING Bank.
The National Bank of Hungary cut four of its five repo rates on Monday by 25 basis points each, of which the benchmark one-week reverse repo facility was reduced to 20.00 percent from 20.25 percent.
Overnight rates traded between 19.375 and 20.125 percent compared with Monday's close of 20.00 percent and the majority of the deals were struck at around 19.50 percent.
Laczi added that money flowing back from the central bank's reverse repo facility might also have contributed to the increase in liquidity.
